newsitem.title: UK: C&W set to win control of Videotron UK assets - FT.
newsitem.headline: C&W set to win control of Videotron UK assets - FT.

text.p: Cable and Wireless remains the favourite to take over the UK assets of Canada's Groupe Videotron, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.
The UK-based international telecoms operator is set to win control of Videotron Holdings, the UK's seventh biggest cable television company, for about 700 million stg, the report said.
But it said that Deutsche Telekom and International CableTel of the U.S. remained interested and were talking to Goldman Sachs, the investment bank handling the sale.
The C&W offer is likely to involve Bell Cablemedia, the Canadian-owned company which is the UK's third largest cable group, the report said.
It owns 26 percent of Videotron Holdings while C&W has 13 percent of Bell. C&W is set to provide the bulk of the finance for the deal in return for an increased stake in Bell, the report said.
